chill.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: There was a slight chill in the air.
I turned on the heater in the hall to take the chill off the house  (=to heat it slightly).
Suddenly aware of the morning chill, she closed the window.
He sat in the chill of the evening, staring out over the city below.
chill.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a sudden feeling of fear or worry, especially because of something cruel or violent
chill.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The sound of his dark laugh sent a chill through her.
There was something in his tone that sent a chill down Melissa’s spine (=made her very frightened).
Fay felt a chill of fear as she watched Max go off with her daughter.
chill.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an illness which causes a slight fever, headache, and shivering (=slight shaking of the body)
chill.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Let’s get these wet clothes off you before you catch a chill.
chill.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a feeling of being cold, caused by being ill
chill.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if you chill something such as food or drink, or if it chills, it becomes very cold but does not freeze
chill.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Spoon the mixture into a bowl and chill for two hours.
The longer this salad chills, the better the flavour.
chill.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to relax completely instead of feeling angry, tired, or nervous
chill.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: ‘Hold it! Just chill for a second, won’t you!’
I spent the afternoon chilling out in front of the TV.
chill.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The wind blew across her body, chilling her wet skin.
Come and sit by the fire – you look chilled to the bone.
chill.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to suddenly frighten someone, especially by seeming very cruel or violent
chill.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: The anger in his face chilled her.
He jerked his head round and saw something that chilled his blood.
chill somebody to the bone/chill somebody to the marrow/chill somebody’s blood
